greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of parts in all partitions of n in which no part occurs more than k times; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0. The triangle contains terms with k <= n. T(n,k) = T(n,n) = A006128(n) for k >= n.
For fixed k > 0, T(n,k) ~ 3^(1/4) * log(k+1) * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*k*n/(3*(k+1)))) / (Pi * (8*k*(k+1)*n)^(1/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 18 2018
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0], `if`(i<1, [0, 0],
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, {1, 0}, If[i < 1, {0, 0}, Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1, k] /. l_List :> {l[[1]], l[[2]] + l[[1]]*j}, {j, 0, Min[n/i, k]}]]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n, n, k][[2]]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 27 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 23 2013
